QString selection

Detailed Description

The center widget of the TextFileEditor class.

This class is based on a QTextEdit or a QPlainTextEdit. This depend on the existance of the define QT_PLAINTEXT at the compilation time. The goal is to remove the QTextEdit. QPlainTextEdit is normally more fast. The possibility of use a QTextEdit is keep in the case of probleme.

bool  deleteWord = false,
bool  dot = true 
)

Return the text who is under the cursor.

Parameters:
cursor The cursor to use to look the text.
deleteWord If true, textUnderCursor will remove the text returned.
dot If true '.' is considered in a word

Replace the selected text by upper case character the parameter.

void TextEditor::lowerSelectedText (  )  [slot]

Replace the selected text by lower case character.

void TextEditor::updateHighlighter (  )  [slot]

Called when the configuration change and it's necessary to update the highlighter. If no highlighter is used, this function do nothing.

void TextEditor::indent ( bool  unindent = false  )  [slot]

Indent or unindent the selected text depending on the parameter.

Parameters:
unindent If false (by default) the text is indented. (the character \t is added), else the text is unindented.

void TextEditor::commentSelectedText ( bool  uncomment = false  )  [virtual, slot]

Comment or Uncomment the selected text depending on the parrameter. If a part of a text is already (un)commented, the balise is moved to comment all the text. Warning: If you comment code with comment, the comment can be merged with code.

Parameters:
uncomment If false (by default) the text is commented, else the text is uncommented

void TextEditor::refreshTextHighlighter (  )  [slot]

Refresh the text highlighter (in case the cursor position change)

void TextEditor::callTextHighlighter (  )  [slot]

Highlight all text equals of the current word under the cursor

Process to do when a user press a key. This method is called when the editor ask to add some text automatically. (ie: close a bracket, ...)
